official-title.#text:
To require consultation with State and local officials prior to awarding a grant or contract for
			 housing facilities for unaccompanied alien children.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Unaccompanied Alien Children Transparency Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Unaccompanied Alien Children Transparency Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 235(i) of the William Wilberforce Trafficking Victims Protection Reauthorization Act of
			 2008
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: William Wilberforce Trafficking Victims Protection Reauthorization Act of 2008/s:235/ss:i

header.#text:
Requirements before awarding grants or contracts for housing facilities for unaccompanied alien
			 children

text.#text:
Before awarding any grant or contract under this subsection that provides for housing of
			 unaccompanied alien children, the

notify in writing State and local elected officials regarding the location of the facility and the
			 duration of the grant or contract;

provide State and local elected officials a written assessment of the grant or contract’s impact on
			 the community’s public safety, and educational and health systems;

provide State and local elected officials a written assessment of the grant or contract’s impact on
			 the community’s fiscal needs;

certify in writing to State and local elected officials that all persons charged with the care of
			 the unaccompanied alien children to be housed at the facility will have
			 undergone background checks and will have been determined not to present a
			 risk to such unaccompanied alien children;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
notifies the State and local
			 elected officials, during which such State and local officials may review
			 the proposed contract or grant, along with the assessment and
			 certifications required by paragraphs (2) through (6);

text.#text: provide for a 30-day period, beginning on the date that the

conduct a public hearing in the locality in which the facility in the grant or contract has been
			 proposed, not later than 10 days after the conclusion of the 30-day
			 comment period described in paragraph (7), for which—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is in attendance in an official
			 capacity for the purpose of receiving public comments;
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Department of Health and Human Services

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
an
			 affirmation of the grant or contract, which, if not timely submitted,
			 shall preclude the
from awarding the grant or contract; and

text.#text:
provide for a 7-day period, beginning on the date that the hearing under paragraph (8) concludes,
			 during which the Governor of the State, may submit to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
an affirmation of the grant or contract, which, if not timely
			 submitted, shall preclude the

from awarding the grant or
			 contract.

text.#text:
provide for a 7-day period, beginning on the date that the period under paragraph (9) concludes,
			 during which a majority of the governing body of the county in which the
			 facility in the grant or contract has been proposed may submit to the
